title: Senior Risk Analyst
description:
**BA Global Talent** is currently looking for a skilled and dedicated talent to join the **DFC**'s Offices as a **Senior** **Credit/Risk Analyst** to provide consultancy services. You will operate with minimal supervision, contributing to research and reports on foreign economic and political landscapes, review financing applications, draft approval papers, and undertake other essential functions for the Mission Transaction Unit (MTU).

The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. If you are passionate about risk management and possess the necessary expertise, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

The DFC invests across various sectors, including energy, healthcare, critical infrastructure, and technology. DFC also provides financing for small businesses and women entrepreneurs in order to create jobs in emerging international markets.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct credit review, analysis, and processing.
* Gather and review due diligence documents from clients, and suggest feedback to origination officers to such documents.
* Either directly spread or prepare request to Credit Policy group for spreading of financial statements from, partners, borrowers, and sponsors.
* Assist origination officers and/or lead in preparation of financing approval papers (e.g. Screening, Credit Committee, Investment Committee and Board papers), particularly in proper formatting of data.
* Review newly submitted applications for financing to identify which parties need to have Character Risk Due Diligence (“CRDD”) conducted. Request and obtain CRDD from Information Center. Review and summarize in writing conclusions.
* Travel to support transactions, as needed
* Conduct country and sector-specific research, particularly as it pertains to incoming transactions (20%)
* Research and summarize in writing the economic and political environment in the foreign countries where proposed projects are located.
* Research and summarize in writing the industrial sector in which proposed projects fall.
* Conduct research and writing of MTU Market Assessments.
* Prepare Country Due Diligence briefing materials prior to an overseas trip by a project team.

**Qualifications**

* Relevant experience in Credit/Risk Analyst
* Ability to analyze complex financial data, identify trends, and assess risk factors effectively.
* Demonstrated ability to meticulously review documents, ensuring accuracy and completeness in credit analysis and due diligence processes.
* Capacity to thrive in a dynamic and rapidly changing work environment, managing multiple tasks simultaneously and meeting tight deadlines.
* Proficient in conducting credit review, financial statement analysis, and risk assessment to support financing decisions.
* Experience in gathering, reviewing, and analyzing due diligence documents from clients, providing feedback to origination officers, and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
* Ability to identify parties requiring CRDD, request and obtain CRDD from the Information Center, and summarize conclusions effectively.
* Capable of conducting country and sector-specific research, analyzing economic and political environments, and preparing comprehensive summaries and briefings for decision-making purposes.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, supporting project teams with country due diligence briefing materials and other relevant information.

This is an **On-site **position 

**DFC Offices - Washington D.C.**

**Time Zone: EST**

**Schedule: Fixed-term Schedule from March 2024 to September 2024**

**BA Global Talent **is a young, fast-growing company that strives to provide high-quality remote and US-based workers to US clients. **BA**** **was founded by a lawyer and a business administrator who harnessed their expertise and relevant local experiences to ensure that demanding employers can find high-quality, remote workers to help their businesses grow.

Job Type: Contract

title: Financial Investigations Analyst
description:
At LegitScript, we are passionate about making the internet and payment ecosystems safer and more transparent. We help companies of all sizes keep their services legal and safe for consumers. To do this, LegitScript combines big data with the world’s leading team of experts skilled in highly regulated and complex sectors, including transaction laundering detection, pharmaceuticals, online gambling, and more.

  

The result? Unmatched accuracy and deep risk analysis that identifies which commercial entities play by the rules, and which do not. Our diverse industry partnerships provide unique insights that keep businesses and governments at the forefront of emerging trends. That’s why LegitScript is trusted by the world's largest search engines, internet platforms, payment companies, and regulatory agencies.


The Analyst is responsible for the accurate analysis and classification of assigned websites, products, and / or merchants. They use open source intelligence, proprietary tools, and industry best practices to identify potential areas of risk or non-compliance. By identifying potentially risky, illegal, or otherwise violative activities, the Analyst contributes directly to LegitScript’s mission of making the internet and payment ecosystems safer and more transparent. They work in a fast paced environment and are comfortable balancing competing priorities and delivering their work within deadlines.

  

What You'll Do:

* Recognize and classify websites within multiple high-risk sectors, especially internet pharmacy, psychoactive high, gambling, and financial trading platforms
* Understand and perform with regular program tasks like research and analysis, documentation, and assistance with ad-hoc client requests
* Understand and utilize the various tools and resources necessary to perform regular program tasks
* Craft written responses or notes for deliverables that only require marginal edits by supervisor
* Escalate questions to Sr. Analysts and Manager using sound judgment
* Submit reports, adhering to your program’s reporting standards, within strict deadlines
* Assist on other projects and tasks when assigned to do so by Manager
* Assist in shaping program improvements by escalating ideas to Manager regarding the following:


	+ Areas where our knowledge and resources are limited
	+ New tools and resources that could improve analysis and/or processes
	+ Potential new and trending areas of risk to client(s)
* Assist in the maintenance of program documentation as directed by Sr. Analysts and Manager

  

What You'll Bring:

* Strong writing skills
* Comfortable accepting feedback for overall growth
* Experience with large data sets (Excel and Google Sheets)
* Fantastic attention to detail
* Self-motivated, independent, resourceful, and curious
* Excellent time management and problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to use good judgment and make sound independent decisions
* Ability to work in a dynamic market with a continuous improvement mindset
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Well-developed ability to speak, read, comprehend, English
* Tech-savvy
* 4-year college or university degree, or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Comfortable with potential exposure to offensive material
* Proficiency using MacOS
* Proficiency with Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Etc.) and Microsoft Excel

  

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

  

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position. We cannot support international remote work.

  

In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package:

* Multiple Medical plans (one with $0 employee premium option), Dental & Vision plans
* 401k with company match and immediate vesting
* Generous paid time off package and 11 paid holidays
* And much more!

  

If you got to this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you just read. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in LegitScript’s mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways – not just candidates who check all the boxes.


The pay range for this role is:
23.22 - 23.22 USD per hour (Remote)

title: Pricing and Market Analyst / Senior Analyst (Remote, Texas)
description:
**Who We Are**


OhmConnect was founded to help bring 100% clean energy to everyone. We are solving massive inefficiencies in energy markets, changing how people use and view energy, and connecting smart homes with the smart grid. We build products that connect deeply with consumers and invite them to take action to positively impact the planet, their communities, and their wallets.


We are an Equal Opportunity employer striving to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment where everyone feels that they have a voice that is heard.


We strongly encourage candidates to check out our website at www.ohmconnect.com to learn more about the world-changing work we are doing.

 **Role summary**


The Pricing and Market Analyst/Senior Analyst is responsible for supporting OCE’s (OhmConnect Energy) ERCOT (Electric Reliability Council of Texas) retail pricing functions. This position will play a critical role in ensuring the products offered meet company objectives for customer acquisition and margin optimization. In addition, this role will actively participate in the ongoing development and valuation of OCE’s Demand Response product.

### **What you will do**

* Manage trade confirmations process to ensure records accurately reflect those of OCE’s wholesale counterparties.
* Price residential energy plans for OhmConnect in Texas to support customer acquisition targets as well as existing customer retention
* Assure accurate deployment of prices across sales channels that meet revenue and gross margin expectations
* Work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing and Operations to develop pricing solutions to meet market / company / customer needs (including new offer development)
* Incorporate relevant internal and external market information to maintain and improve pricing model (TDU charges, AS costs, RECs etc.); maintain inputs and calculations.
* Track wholesale pricing to ensure competitive market position
* Actively support Risk Management efforts by tracking supply cost and purchases
* Update and monitor data in the load forecasting system
* Analysis (Economic, competitive, business planning, and other ad hoc)
* Streamline reporting to internal and external stakeholders
* Fill knowledge gaps through self-driven learning; SME in ERCOT market changes; value of DR

**Requirements**

* Minimum of 2 years experience in a retail energy supply or pricing role; preferably ERCOT.
* Retail energy experience required (Residential). Small Commercial Experience a Plus.
* Strong commercial acumen
* Superior analytical and modeling skills
* Voracious learner
* Ability to work through details while never losing sight of larger business objectives
* Technologically driven to build scalable, efficient processes
* Ability to thrive in a fully remote work environment
* Bachelor's Degree in business, mathematics or related field

**Benefits**

### **What you'll get**

* A competitive salary based on experience. The base salary for this role is: $72k-$115k
* Fully remote work environment with home office set-up allowance.
* Real and lived work-life balance - Company perks include unlimited vacation (which our C-level team actively encourages everyone to take!), parental leave, and a corporate values of working sustainably and putting families first.
* Competitive benefits package that includes full suite of wellness benefits and stock options.

Opportunity to work with amazing people who are passionate about halting climate change, thriving in a fully-remote work environment, and learning and growing every day.  
* **Not eligible for visa sponsorship.**
* EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
* Individuals seeking employment at OhmConnect are considered without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender identification, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, veteran or military status, unfavorable military discharge, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law.
* We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Treasury Management Product Analyst Sr. - Deposits & Liquidity
description:
**Job Summary:**


Analyzes data for existing and potential markets to support the efforts of developing corporate strategies for Treasury Management services. May provide information and data to assist with identifying opportunities for product expansion and development, support of vendor negotiations and product administration. May assist with the sales administration functions.


**Job Duties and Responsibilities:*** Collaborates with multiple functional groups in the process of developing corporate strategies for Treasury Management. Will assist in identifying and analyzing product opportunities, and proposing product recommendations based on potential profitability.
* May participate in the research and analysis of corporate, industry, economic and political data and trends to identify possible opportunities, and provide valid and useful information to assist in determining the direction of the products' expansion and development
* May be engaged in various phases of the development, implementation, operations and settlement process; providing regular written updates to management on projects and issues that are in progress. May provide tangible inputs in the product planning and design process; maintains active participation throughout the release and post-release activities.
* May participate in the planning, establishing and communication of Treasury Management product sales goals and other sales administration functions.
* May assist Product Managers and Sales Managers with team member education, customer support and product support on developing training courses, designing demos and positioning products
* Works proactively with Product Managers and Sales Managers to assist in developing new products and to enhance and promote existing products. Monitors relationships with outside vendors, as appropriate, in partnership with Operations, IT, Marketing, Legal, Audit, Compliance and other Synovus Bank departments.
* Helps to develop strategies and programs to encourage new or expanded banking relationships, where applicable.
* Leverages various information sources to support strategic and tactical business decisions.
* Oversees critical daily support functions, which include reporting and monitoring activities.
* May orient, train or review the work of lower level analysts.
* Interacts primarily with peers in other functional areas, managers and customers, which may involve controversial situations or trying to influence others.
* Each team member is expected to be aware of risk within their functional area. This includes observing all policies, procedures, laws, regulations and risk limits specific to their role. Additionally, they should raise and report known or suspected violations to the appropriate Company authority in a timely fashion.
* Performs other related duties as required.

The information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.


Synovus is an Equal Opportunity Employer supporting diversity in the workplace

  

  

**Minimum Education:**


Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, or related field or an equivalent combination of education and commercial banking experience.


**Minimum Experience:**


Six (6) plus years of experience in Commercial Payment, Treasury Management Services and/or Commercial Banking. **Liquidity experience required.**


**Required Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:**


**Strong Communication and Presentation Skills:**


* Exceptional ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
* Demonstrated skill in delivering clear and compelling presentations.

**Treasury Management Expertise:**


* Direct experience in Treasury Management Sales, Treasury Management Operations, or Treasury Management Client Support.
* In-depth knowledge and understanding of Treasury Management applications and products.

**Excellent Project Management Skills:**


* Proven ability to effectively manage projects from initiation to completion.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to ensure successful project outcomes.

**Leadership and Influencing Skills:**


* Demonstrated leadership abilities with the capacity to influence individuals and drive collaborative efforts.
* Ability to motivate and inspire cross-functional teams to achieve desired outcome

**Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint:**


* Strong competency in using Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
* Ability to create professional documents, analyze data, and create impactful presentations.

**Analytical Skills:**


* Strong analytical aptitude with the ability to review and interpret data with attention to detail.
* Proficiency in identifying patterns, trends, and insights to inform decision-making.

**Data Gathering and Decision-making:**


* Ability to gather relevant data points, synthesize information, and use critical thinking to arrive at well-informed decisions.
* Skill in crafting a cohesive narrative to support decision-making processes.

**Business Acumen and Prioritization:**


* Utilization of business understanding and acumen to prioritize tasks, ensuring that the right activities are executed at the righttime.
* Ability to align strategic goals with day-to-day operations and make informed choices based on business priorities.
  

  

**Preferred Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:**


Certified Treasury Professional (CTP) Certification

title: Senior Workplace and Retirement Solutions Analyst
description:
At Cetera we need detailed thinkers to help us deliver quality and value to our clients. As an experienced analyst, you know how to uncover trends and tell meaningful stories through data. You collect, organize, and interpret information with ease and understand the impact your insights have on our business. We are currently seeking to add an experienced Senior Workplace and Retirement Solutions Analyst to our team. The Senior Solutions Development Analyst role is responsible for understanding and translating complex business issues and recommended solutions to the Workplace & Retirement department. These recommendations are then considered and adopted to create new revenue streams, tap into new markets, improve Ceteraâ€™s overall value proposition, and provide Cetera financial professionals with a suite of workplace and retirement solutions for their employees.

Partner with Marketing, Communications, Executives/Leaders, all other operational and technical stakeholders from planning through implementation.

* Demonstrated ability to manage changing requirements and short timelines
* Ability to act tactically and think strategically
* Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
* [Bachelor's degree in business or a related field or equivalent.

**Compensation**

The base annual salary range for this role is $110,000 to $140,000 plus a competitive performance-based bonus. To ensure that our Employees can make the most of their time outside of working hours, we offer a competitive salary and for full-time roles, a benefits package including:

title: Project Management Analyst, Global Development - Delivery Practice
description:

Solving the worldâ€™s most pressing issues and improving the quality of life for people worldwide is what we do every day at Abt Associates. Creating a more equitable world is no small task, but we are driven by big challenges.


We are a team of 3,000+ people in over 50 countries working in unison and focused on the bigger picture. Only by sharing our commitment, energy, and innovation do we affect change and push the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible. We welcome diverse ideas, backgrounds, and viewpoints â€“ joining Abt means access to exceptional thinkers at the top of their game.


To thrive at Abt is to embrace flexibility and collaboration. Our open culture allows you to balance your work and personal life as needed to optimize personal well-being. title: Audience Research Analyst
description:
Overview:

The Office of Policy, Planning, and Resources for Public Diplomacy and Public Affairs’ Research and Evaluation Unit (R/PPR/REU) is looking to add two Audience Research Analysts to their unit.
Responsibilities:  

* Develops integrated audience research approaches diplomacy practitioners in reaching the right audiences with the right messages and programs.
* Conducts formative research into audience needs and country context to guide the development of public diplomacy programs/campaigns and monitoring and evaluation of those programs/campaigns.
* Manages data on audiences and competitors, including from existing audience research, market research, and opinion polling.
* Analyzes gaps in available research, recommends the commission of new research, and oversees the execution of that research.
* Works with the IT development team to create customized interactive reports and dashboards for embassies abroad.
* Uses various analysis tools to understand and identify trends in major (e.g. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) and specialized social media platforms and websites in general.
* Tracks trends in regional and global media and information environments including news provision and information circulation vis-a-vis foreign policy and public diplomacy.
* Assists government staff with development and review of contracting documents for the procurement of research services.
* Provides consultation to public diplomacy practitioners on how to use audience research to inform and improve programs that advance foreign policy objectives.
* Curates existing research from both USG and non-USG sources.
* Regularly presents results to public diplomacy practitioners, academics, and other interested parties through both formal and informal presentations.
* Looks for new trends and tools in audience data analysis and connects with equivalent governmental and non-governmental organizations and research entities to discover new methods and update best practices.
* Contributes to the development of training modules and courses for public diplomacy practitioners on how to use audience research tools. Conducts training for public diplomacy practitioners as part of a team.

Qualifications:
* A Bachelor’s Degree is required; a Master’s Degree or higher is preferred. Training should reflect training in qualitative or quantitative research methods. Training in the use of data visualization and social media analytics software preferred.
* Four or more years experience designing and managing audience research, market research, or opinion polling is required;
* Experience conducting research on one or more of the following topics: nation branding, strategic communication, product marketing, market research, public relations, political campaigns, trust, entertainment education, ICT for development, media effects, disinformation,, interpersonal communication, organizational communication, networks, trust, or public opinion.
* Experience collecting qualitative or quantitative data in foreign countries, including selecting, training or supervising local research teams; overseeing translation of instruments, protocols, and other research materials; and administering instruments in English (or other language, as necessary);
* Experience with audience research and/or opinion polling methods for large-scale initiatives, including identifying key metrics, establishing data collection processes, creating data curation, management and ethics practices; and creating reports;
* Experience with statistical analysis tools such as R or Stata, data visualization software, and/or social media research tools such as Trendkite, NodeXL, Crimson Hexagon (Brandwatch), Quid, Netbase, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud;
* Experience managing complex projects involving multiple stakeholders, with milestones occurring over one to two years;
* Experience with traditional research methods, including but not limited to: surveys, focus group facilitation, content analysis, and textual analysis.
* Ability to approach problems analytically and holistically, considering the individual problem and the impact on the larger system;
* Ability to work on complex projects within a multidisciplinary team;
* Ability to work flexibly and efficiently in a rapidly changing environment, exercising a balance between research rigor and client needs;
* Demonstrate curiosity in continued learning and growth on the job;
* Openness to critique and feedback (including from other disciplines), curiosity to learn from a spectrum of perspectives, and experience or strong interest in collaborating closely with others; and,
* Ability to focus on and understand the needs of internal and external clients.

 **AAP/EEO Statement:**  

DNI complies with all federal, state and local laws designed to protect employees and job applicants from discrimination based on race, religion, color, sex, parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military service, or other non-merit-based factors

title: D365 Customer Insights Data Specialist
description:
A Dynamics Customer Insights Data Specialist is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing data solutions using Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365 Customer Insights. This role requires a combination of technical skills and business acumen, as well as the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders and customers.


**Responsibilities**


Data Engineering


* Design and implement data engineering solutions using Azure services and best practices.


* Develop, test, and monitor data pipelines and workflows using Azure Data Factory and Azure Synapse Analytics


* Perform data ingestion, transformation, and integration from various sources, such as relational databases, files, streams, and APIs.


* Optimize data performance, quality, and reliability using Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Fabric, or Azure Databricks


* Participate in Scrum software development life cycle using Azure DevOps and Git for code management and collaboration.


* Document and communicate data engineering solutions and architectures to stakeholders and clients.


* Stay updated with the latest trends and innovations and service features / developments in data engineering and Azure technologies.


Dynamics 365 Customer Insights


* Configure and customize Customer Insights to integrate data from various sources.


* Develop and maintain data quality rules, data enrichment processes, and data segmentation criteria using Customer Insights.


* Create and optimize customer profiles, segments, KPIs, and measures using Customer Insights.


* Assist functional consultants in implementing data-driven customer journeys and marketing campaigns using Customer Insights and Dynamics 365 Marketing.


* Monitor and troubleshoot data ingestion, processing, and synchronization issues using Customer Insights and Azure tools.


* Provide training and support to business users on how to use Customer Insights and related Power BI dashboards and reports.


**Qualifications**


* At least 3 years of experience in data engineering, data analysis, or data science using Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.


* Certification in MB-260: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.


* Proficient in SQL or Python for data manipulation and analysis.


* Proficient in Power BI, Power Query, DAX, and M for data visualization and low-code data transformation.


* Familiar with Azure DevOps, Git or other version control software and process.


* Excellent communication, presentation, and problem-solving skills.


* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


**Benefits**:


* 100% Remote Role
* OSDE (family plan)
* Payment in USD
* Paid vacations
* Referral Bonus Program
* Flexible schedule
* Work equipment
* Learning and Development programs, trainings and certifications - Udemy Business License

title: SAP Project Systems Configuration Analyst
description:
The SAP Financial Project Systems Analyst is a subject matter expert on a wide variety of areas/topics inside the SAP ECC and S/4HANA systems, specifically in the PS, FI, and CO modules. As part of the ERP team, this team member will work with business resources and development teams throughout the complete project life cycle. Responsibilities will include defining business processes, driving the analysis of business requests to identify the best solution from an SAP perspective, configuring the SAP application, authoring functional specifications, and providing SAP support activities.
Responsibilities* Participate in analysis and design of business processes and implement SAP system and other business applications enhancements to support the process changes.
* Configure the SAP system to facilitate business processes and transaction flows
* Analyze, understand, and support reporting throughout the organization
* Execute configuration requests for SAP
* Researches and identifies new business opportunities and improvements and promotes innovation by identifying and establishing standard and alternative methods to address project complexity and maintain a competitive advantage.
* Researches and recommends enterprise-wide best practices, standards, tools, and process improvements to meet business needs.
* Provide training to end users and create end-user documentation as needed
* Educates the organization on the role, processes, and importance of business systems analysis to provide expertise and value and to foster optimal working relationships, collaboration, and effective communication.


Minimum Requirements:* Must be a U.S. Citizen or US Person
* Bachelor’s degree. Four additional years of experience may be substituted for a degree
* Minimum of 5 years of related work experience
* SAP applications experience, including process and configuration knowledge
* At least 2 full lifecycle SAP project implementations and experience in a production system support role.


Preferred Qualifications* Expert knowledge of SAP Project Systems (knowledge of PS structures like: WBS, Network, Milestones, Cost Planning, Budgeting, Scheduling, Multi Resource scheduling, Project quotation, Time sheets, settlement rules, etc.)A/P, A/R, Billing and Revenue Recognition, Asset Management, and GL
* SAP S/4HANA Project Systems implementation experience
* Knowledge of and work within the Agile methodology preferred.
* Individual must be able to communicate recommendations effectively to all levels in the organization.
* Strong business acumen to quickly learn new business processes and understand how IT needs to support the business
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills to effectively translate ideas, concepts and information
* Strong collaboration skills to effectively communicate with both business and technical IT teams
* Excellent analytical skills and ability to translate business functionality and opportunities into clear, precise and easy-to-read functional specifications critical
* Experience in a regulated environment
* Extensive knowledge of business operations, strategies and objectives and strong facilitation, consensus building and presentation skills required.
* Well-grounded in business principles, processes and concepts related to finance, sales, manufacturing, and distribution
* Demonstrated ability to work in a diverse environment rather than specialized on a single module
* Demonstrated ability to analyze business requirements and translate them into system-supported solutions
* Must be able to handle multiple priorities at one time and remain results-oriented
* Must work well both independently and in a team environment
* Knowledge of Concur, VIM, and Vertex strongly desired
* Working knowledge and/or expertise in CATS, Earned Value Management (EVM), and resource related billing
* Working knowledge and/or expertise in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)
* Familiarity with Dassian and/or other Aerospace and Defense SAP solution extensions
* Understanding of SAP Security


#LI-AE1
Our salary ranges are market-driven and set to allow for flexibility. Individual pay will be competitive based on a candidate’s unique set of knowledge, skills, and geographic diversity, with earnings potential commensurate with experience. The range for this position is:
$87,000.00 - $145,000.00 annually.  


Additionally, this position is incentive eligible with a target based on contribution, company performance, and/or individual results achieved; the specific incentive plan and target amount will be determined based on the role and breadth of contributions.*Maxar employees must follow all applicable Maxar policies and COVID-19 requirements as well as those of Maxar customers and third parties. title: Sr Market Research Consultant
description:
Position Description:

At Capital Blue Cross, we promise to go the extra mile for our team and our community. This promise is at the heart of our culture, and it’s why our employees consistently vote us one of the “Best Places to Work in PA.”


This position is responsible for:

* Conducting market research, customer experience research, regulatory surveys, and other ad-hoc research.
* Monitoring of customer perceptions/feedback and market performance primarily through corporate-wide research studies, departmental requests, and other ad-hoc research inquiries.
* Managing vendor relationships as they relate to ad-hoc research requests, NCQA/CMS surveys, and required BCBSA surveys.
* Assessing requests for surveys/research and makes recommendations on the best options for how to proceed.
* Administrative, tactical and analytical components of primary market research studies, as appropriate.
* Project management tasks, interpreting data, formulating reports and making recommendations/sharing implications based upon research findings.@@Managing a heavy research agenda.


Responsibilities and Qualifications:
* Serves as a consultant to all areas of the company on survey and research initiatives. Identifies the best options for uncovering the most suitable manner to obtain the information required for decision-making.
* Conducts and manages corporate wide market research to support corporate strategic plans. Serves as a participant for CBC in the BCBSA Market Research workgroup.
* Manages BCBSA, regulatory, Medicare, etc. surveys as required by association or law. Works with the BCBSA, vendors, and CBC stakeholders to ensure that all required surveys are done in compliance with the rules defined and results are shared appropriately, and timely.
* Supports/Assists with the AIP Member Satisfaction survey for Capital BlueCross.
* Supports the work of the Plan Performance Improvement Committee (PPIC)
* Supports multiple departments at Capital BlueCross, not limited to, but including Medicare, Retail, Sales, Strategy, Process Improvement, Clinical, and others with ad hoc survey requests. Reviews the request and makes a recommendation on the most efficient and effective way to gather the information. Serves as a consultant to multiple areas in the company to assist them achieving their research goals/objectives.
* Develops programs to capture, analyze, act and monitor feedback across consumer touch points when engaging with CBC and/or its subsidiary companies, to help drive business value (through use of the customer/market insights).
* Other duties as assigned.

**Skills:**

* Strong analytical skills, ability to work independently and to develop, coordinate, and manage multiple projects and priorities with minimal supervision.
* Ability to work well with internal and external customers, vendors, and stakeholders. Proficient in the use of pc-based software.
* Must possess excellent analytical aptitude.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills. Demonstrated proficiency in the timely and accurate completion of all projects as assigned.
* Ability to develop, coordinate, and manage major projects and related activities, among multiples business lines and to manage project design, development and implementation with both internal and external audiences.
* Ability to use data/information to convey clear, concise research findings.
* Health care/health insurance market research knowledge is strongly preferred, related in particular to:
* Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems (CAHPS) surveys
* QHP Enrollee Experience Surveys
* Voice of the Customer programs across various channels and methodologies
* Online market research communities (MROC or e-Communities)
* The ideal candidate will:
* Possess critical thinking, analytical skills, and be able to apply appropriate research methodologies.
* Be able to manage to deadlines, while having flexible thinking and problem-solving skills
* Communicate with internal and external stakeholders to understand/document business objectives.
* Assist with designing and developing questionnaires, discussion guides, and the like.
* Analyze/interpret data to communicate findings, and actionable insights.
* Project manage research initiatives, when applicable
* Be able to assess/estimate the appropriate level of effort/time needed to complete work as planned and manage time accordingly.
* Be able to work independently or collaboratively.
* Be detail-oriented and curious about what drives people's perceptions, opinions, beliefs, attitudes, and behaviors.

**Knowledge:**

* Strong knowledge of and experience working with statistical software (such as SPSS, or Advanced Excel)
* Moderate to high proficiency using Microsoft Office products.
* Knowledge of online survey software (specifically Qualtrics) including programming, data reporting and analysis, creating dashboards, and using CX suite/tools

**Experience:**

* 7 years of experience
* Prior experience within health care and/or payer systems, preferred.

 **Education and Certifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Social Sciences, Psychology, Marketing, Market Research or education that represents some combination of the above

**Location:**

* This position is classified hybrid, which requires onsite work on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.
**Work Environment:**

* Ability to work minimum 37.5 hours/week!!Office Setting/Remote available (location TBD)!!The ability to occasionally lift and or move up to 5 lbs.

**Physical Demands:**

* While performing the duties of the job, the employee is frequently required to sit, use hands and fingers, talk, hear, and see.
* The employee must be able to work over 40 hours per week.
* The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 5 pounds.


About Us: We recognize that work is a part of life, not separate from it, and foster a flexible environment where your health and wellbeing are prioritized. At Capital you will work alongside a diverse and caring team of supportive colleagues and be encouraged to volunteer in your community. We value your professional and personal growth by investing heavily in training and continuing education, so you have the tools to do your best as you develop your career. And by doing your best, you’ll help us live our mission of improving the health and well-being of our members and the communities in which they live.

title: Senior Research Analyst - Grain and Oil Seeds
description:
Why should you join our team?
American AgCredit offers a unique opportunity to be a part of a national financial system supporting those who feed, clothe and fuel the world. We are a growing organization embracing collaboration and innovation while delivering transformative solutions. American AgCredit provides a cultivating environment where you truly make a difference for our customers and teams.
Benefits offered by American AgCredit:* Commitment to agriculture and the communities we serve
* Family friendly work environment
* Investment in employee development
* Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
* Outstanding 401k – automatic 3% employer contribution, plus match up to 6%
* Generous Paid Time Off (Vacation accrued at 26 days annually, Sick Days accrued at 15 days annually, 12 paid holidays, plus 16 hours of volunteer time)
* Competitive Incentive Compensation Plan
* Disability & Life Insurance
* Employee mental, physical, and financial wellness programs
* The position is bonus eligible based on association and personal performance


Position will be posted until filled.
BASIC FUNCTION:
The Senior Research Analyst will work closely with the members of the Terrain function of American AgCredit, Farm Credit Services of America/Frontier Farm Credit (the Associations) to provide thought leadership to customers, prospective customers, and association leaders.
An integral part of the research and analytics team, this senior analyst will generate original research, visit customers/prospective customers, speak at industry events, participate in industry groups and work to connect the trends and insights across the ag value chain with the information our customers, prospective customers and Associations find valuable. This individual will utilize data, market trends, and insights to better support senior leaders and our clients as they work to make informed decisions. Their work provides insights into what is driving change in the market to inform both internal and external stakeholders including the associated opportunities and risks each sub sector is or might be facing over the next several years.
Analysts will work in a collaborative way across sector specialties to strategically identify sector correlations and interdependencies. By providing deep sector insight, market research, and analysis, the senior research analysts will create a lasting value proposition to our customers, and incent prospective customers to move their business to the Associations.
This position requires the ability to manage multiple projects, a deep level of expertise and understanding of agricultural industry, as well as the ability to build credibility through data, research, and storytelling. The idea candidate has extensive experience in agricultural research and analysis, is well-connected in the agricultural value chain, understands the interconnectedness of that value chain and can lead the production of valuable research for the businesses within it.
This individual will conduct research relevant to their assigned sector, and prepare research reports, deliver presentations for clients, contribute to business proposals, and to provide specific insights and knowledge to other stake holders as needed within the association.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES:* Regularly produce salient content that adds value to the Associations, our customers, and our prospective customers.
* Develop deep marketplace credibility and sector expertise; Analyze and research key agricultural markets.
* Formulation of unbiased outlooks to enhance the intelligence available to the Associations, as well as our customers and prospective customers.
* Offer a public presence via earned media, speaking engagements and social content.
* Provide insight and counsel to Capital Markets teams and customers.
* Work closely with the Head of Engagement (as well as the Associations brand, marketing, communications, storytelling, and customer education groups) to plan and execute the strategic, thoughtful sharing of content produced.
* Develop relationships with lending teams across Association territories to enhance the value they can offer their customers and prospective customers.
* Collaborate with other Farm Credit Associations, customer groups, commodity associations, and other key stakeholders.
* Partner closely with brand, marketing, communications, storytelling, and customer education groups to share content thoughtfully and strategically.
* Provide insights and expertise to Association functions, including credit, risk, banking, executive teams and other groups that informs Association planning, operations, and risk strategy, with an “outside” but credible forward-looking view.
* Work collaboratively with other analysts and provide support in various
* Aligns with other analysts/CRAO on research agenda.
* Identifies and refers lending opportunities within the target sectors.
* Prepares strategic data driven research publications.
* Produces reports in addition to the research to be shared with stakeholders.
* Engages with clients by weighing in on research-based knowledge in the form of presentations, on site visits, board meetings, etc.
* Support business growth by creating innovative and unique ways of thinking backed up by research insights.
* Presentations at media conferences.
* Travel required.


LEVELS OF SUPERVISION EXERCISED AND RECEIVED:
Reports to the Chief Research and Analytics Officer.
TYPICAL EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business, Agricultural Economics or a related field
* Master’s degree Preferred.
* 10+ years of related industry work experience and research.
* Expert with research, large data sets and databases, financial analysis.
* Demonstrated experience in thought-leading research.
* Robust understanding of agricultural practices, trends, and industry data.
* Experience in developing, working, or managing research projects and initiatives.
* Deeply committed to U.S. production agriculture.
* Experience engaging with, and providing insight to, individuals and organizations across the agricultural value chain.
* Ability to work in a cross-functional manner with internal and external stakeholders.
* Ability to manage multiple projects, and measure results.
* Ability to work with others at a high and collaborative level.
* Demonstration of extensive reputation for collaboration and relationship management.
* Experienced at mathematical and reasoning ability including statistical and econometric analysis.


ESSENTIAL JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Must have the ability to perform basic office tasks and work in a typical office setting. Employee will be sitting for extended periods of time and accomplishing work at a desk and work at a computer for an extended period. Must have strong written and verbal communication skills to adequately convey ideas and work well with a team. Ability to talk and hear, sit and use their hands and fingers, and reach in all directions is essential in performance of the job. Some lifting and moving of items up to 25 pounds required. Work during established business hours and may require occasional weekend and/or evening work. Travel required.
FULL-TIME REMOTE: These roles and job functions can be done remotely, while maintaining our strong commitment to customer service and our business goals. Employees are welcome to come to an office to work if needed, and some travel for team meetings will be required.
PAY RANGE
Minimum $144,282.40 - Max $225,441.25 Annual*This range is reflective of the national salary average for this position and will be adjusted using geographic variance for physical location of the hired candidate. American AgCredit may compensate outside of the salary range for bona fide reasons not related to membership in a protected class.*
#LI-REMOTE
All hiring is contingent on eligibility to work in the United States. We are unable to sponsor or transfer visas for applicants.
American AgCredit provides equal opportunity in employment to all employees and applicants. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, genetic information, medical condition, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, military service or veteran status, victims of domestic violence, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. American AgCredit prohibits harassment of any individuals on any of the bases listed above.  

  

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at jobs@agloan.com.

title: Graduate Research Analyst
description:
**Job no:** 502706  

**Work type:** Part-Time  

**Location:** Remote, University City - Philadelphia, PA  

**Categories:** Drexel University, Westphal College of Media Arts & Design  

**Job Summary**



The Nowak Metro Finance Lab at the Lindy Institute for Urban Innovation at Drexel University is seeking applicants for a Graduate Research Analyst internship for the summer of 2024. The Graduate Research Analyst will work directly with Bruce Katz, founding Director of the Nowak Metro Finance Lab, and his team of Research Officers, in developing original research for publication and application with our network of practitioner partners.



The Nowak Lab is leading a series of major initiatives helping city and state leaders respond to the complex challenges and opportunities driven by reshoring of manufacturing, decarbonization of energy assets and electrification of mobility, remilitarization and increases in defense spending, the acceleration of remote work, the and the rise of parasitic capital in city and suburban housing markets, all while unprecedented federal investments flows compel cities to organize themselves in radically different ways. The Nowak Lab works directly with state and local leaders, as well as partners organizations like the Aspen Institute’s Latinos and Society Program and Accelerator for America, which share and promote our work and elevate the potential for rapid replication and adaptation of successful models.



Summer 2024 projects include:


* Mapping Manufacturing Ecosystems: analyzing geographic and commercial relationships between large companies, small suppliers, energy and logistics infrastructure, R&D universities, skill-providing community colleges, in collaboration and federal, state, and local governments and business organizations to help maximize the inclusive and sustainable potential of the industrial/energy transition.
* Procurement Playbooks: actionable reports which (a) diagnose the current spending patterns and practices of key public entities and private sector entities (e.g., utilities); and (b) recommend strategies to enable local and disadvantaged enterprises to take full advantage of contracting opportunities and scale their firms by engaging ecosystems of procurement entities, business chambers, entrepreneurial support organizations, and capital providers.
* Climate Transition: identify vulnerable supply chain firms in legacy sectors for the purpose of designing a supplier adjustment program.
* Investment Playbooks: design plans to harness unprecedented volume of federal spending rewards cities and communities by identifying high priority projects in specific geographic locations that can be matched to specific funding opportunities, including commercial and innovation corridors, central business districts and broader industrial areas.
* Innovation Districts: study how innovation districts can support the reshoring of production, through corporate and academy campuses that give manufacturing firms access to applied research and skilled workers.
* Housing Solutions Bank: codify cutting edge financial approaches to the production and preservation of affordable housing.


**Essential Functions**


* Perform original research, data analysis and develop strategies related to Lab’s areas of focus.
* Analyze and synthesize research findings into memos, white papers, and reports.
* Develop at least one newsletter or report to be co-authored with the Director and/or Lab staff.
* Communicate and coordinate with internal staff and external stakeholders via email and phone to ensure deliverable timelines and expectations are met.
* Work with the Lab staff to coordinate graphic design efforts for report products.
* Other related duties as necessary.


**Required Qualifications**


* Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in real estate finance, public finance, city/regional planning (with a focus on public-private partnerships), urban strategy, business administration, public policy, or another allied field.
* Must be currently enrolled in a graduate-level, degree-seeking program.
* Ability to be a creative thinker and problem-solver.
* Ability to be a highly organized self-starter.
* Ability to work independently with minimal direction.
* Strong research, writing and communication skills to synthesize complex research into digestible findings.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Ability to travel to Philadelphia once or twice during assignment.


**Location**


* Remote


**Additional Information**



This is a **Part-time** **Temporary** position classified as **Non-exempt.** The offered pay is based on the successful candidate’s qualifications and experience, department budget, and an internal equity review.



For information on our benefits offerings please review the Per Diem/Casual/Temporary Benefit Fact Sheet.


**Special Instructions to the Applicant**



Please make sure you upload your CV/resume and cover letter when submitting your application.



Review of applicants will begin once a suitable candidate pool is identified.


**Advertised:** Feb 27 2024 Eastern Standard Time  

**Applications close:** Mar 27 2024 Eastern Daylight Time

title: Underwriting Analyst-- PBM/Healthcare
description:
As an Underwriting Analyst, this role is key in winning new business and renewing existing clients by creating proposals that align to CerpassRx’s business model. You will work closely with other key areas of our business to assist with the process improvement and keeping up to date with market trends.

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Developing pricing recommendations for commercial LOB based on in-depth competitive analysis
* Support the Request for Proposals (RFPs) process for new, existing business, and client market-checks
* Use proprietary Underwriting Model, Excel, and SQL to analyze both prospective and existing client’s pharmacy cost of goods, rebates, underlying drivers of cost, as well as CerpassRx’s margin, to produce a final proposal bid
* Creating and updating pricing documents to reflect CerpassRx’s pricing and contract term proposals
* Support the marketing & RFP team in designing and publishing client proposals
* Advise CerpassRx Legal as an Underwriting subject matter expert during contract design
* Compiling PBM data requests
* Completing formulary disruption and network evaluations on prospect opportunities
* Assist with research, recommendations, and implementation of reporting documents to improve accuracy of the Underwriting Model and enhance PBM responses on RFP bids
* Completing disruption analyses on winning bids to assist the implementation team to aid in the onboarding process from incumbent PBM to CerpassRx
* Developing and maintaining relationships with Sales and Account Management
* The applicant’s involvement in projects will be interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques in projects related to the organizations internal financial strategy, network strategy, client side and pharmacy side contracting, rebates, underwriting, margin analysis, and vendor relationships
* Will work alone and in groups to collaboratively solve business problems and develop the functionality our business clients demand
* Perform required work on assignments with little direction and on a timely basis.
* Experience working with data warehouses a plus
* Multi-tasking – need to be able to address multiple tasks simultaneously
* Ability to effectively communicate with business and technical team members
* Experience working in a team environment

Qualifications

**Qualifications and Education Requirements**

To be a part of the team you must meet or exceed the following requirements:

* 2+ years of PBM experience
* 2+ years of underwriting experience, pharmacy network experience, analytics experience, or a combination of these
* 3+ years of Microsoft Excel, Access, etc.
* Experience with pharmacy contracting and network build
* Successful experience with working from home or remote
* BS/BA degree or higher

**Preferred Skills**

* Advanced Microsoft SQL (T-SQL) skillset a plus
* PowerBI experience a plus
* Above average in attention to detail
* Well organized
* Confident in their abilities
* Assertive, but not aggressive or arrogant
* A great team player
* Professional and polite

Able to work independently with minimal management oversight

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $58,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* PBM/Healthcare: 2 years (Required)
* Underwriting: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

### **Description and Requirements**

  

Job Description **About TELUS International**
TELUS International (NYSE: TIXT) focuses on the value of human connection to design, build and deliver high-tech, high-touch customer experiences powered by next-gen digital solutions. With almost 75,000 team members and delivery centers across 30 countries in Africa, Asia, North and Central America, and Europe, TELUS International empowers customer experience innovation through digital enablement, spirited teamwork, agile thinking, and a caring culture that puts customers first. The company's solutions cover customer experience, content moderation, digital transformation, IT lifecycle, advisory and digital consulting, risk management, and back-office support. Fueling any stage of company growth, TELUS International partners with some of the world’s most disruptive brands from fast-growing tech, financial services and fintech, games, travel and hospitality, healthcare, and ICT industries. The company serves clients in over 50 languages. Learn more at: telusinternational.com**Responsibilities*** Build and advance TELUS International’s Analyst Relations strategy in support of our corporate vision and mission
* Identify, engage and establish strategic relationships across a broad portfolio of analysts, driving thought leadership and market positioning
* Own and manage AR operations including positioning RFIs, briefings, inquiries, research and strategy development, while implementing a systematic engagement plan
* Create compelling and sophisticated content for analyst briefings, ensuring a high level of messaging consistency and positioning impact
* Monitor performance of TI’s AR program including building KPIs, tracking engagement and analyst sentiment, and gather insights to help improve strategy and execution
* Collaborate with various internal stakeholders to drive analyst engagement and aid product, sales and marketing development initiatives
* Organize, analyze, and disseminate insights from analyst research such as market sizing, trends, competitive positioning, etc. in support of our strategy initiatives

 **Requirements*** Bachelor’s degree in Management/Marketing. Master’s/MBA preferred.

* Excellent communications and presentation skills
* Ability to collaborate and forge relationships with geographically diverse teams and orchestrate complex data gathering initiatives

title: Senior Product Analyst II
description:
The worldwide data management software market is massive (According to IDC, the worldwide database software market, which it refers to as the database management systems software market, was forecasted to be approximately $82 billion in 2023 growing to approximately $137 billion in 2027. This represents a 14% compound annual growth rate). At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.



The Senior Product Analyst II will play a meaningful role in further developing our rapidly growing Data Analytics function. Partnering with stakeholders across Product Management, Engineering and Analytics teams, as well as with other teams around the business, this role will surface key insights to drive business decision making. This role requires someone with strong analytical and technical skills, and who is comfortable partnering with stakeholders at all levels of the organization and across multiple functional areas in a fast-paced, challenging environment.



This role can be based remote out of North America or one of our regional offices.


### **Responsibilities**


* Develop a deep understanding of what types of features and products customers are using across different stages of their MongoDB lifecycle, find pain points, and conduct deep-dives to provide actionable recommendations that improve the customer experience
* Define KPIs and diagnostic metrics that help improve the user experience
* Surface insights to drive executive decision making across the business
* Create measurement frameworks to measure the success of each product
* Conduct deep dive analysis to assess product performance and health
* Serve as an analytical and technical thought partner to stakeholders across the product, analytics, data science teams
* Make the team more efficient: Research and implement new tooling/processes; seek out and automate existing costly manual processes

### **Skills & attributes**


* 5+ years of hands-on analytics experience with for product and / or growth teams, ideally at a software company
* Advanced SQL skills and proficiency with either Python or R
* Deep understanding of SaaS products and demonstrated success of partnering with product teams to conduct a wide range of experiments
* Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and set priorities with a variety of key stakeholders at all levels of the organization
* Effective at communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences
* Committed to contributing to a collaborative, enjoyable, and psychologically safe work environment


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we're committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees' wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it's like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!



MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.



MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and makes all hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


MongoDB's base salary range for this role is posted below. title: Team Lead, Client Strategy & Insights (Public Sector)
description:
**Our Mission**

As the world’s number 1 job site\\*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(\\*comScore Total Visits, September 2023)

**Day to Day**

The Team Lead position is part of the Client Strategy, Insights, and Experience team and broader Sales Strategy team. As a Team Lead, you be a player-coach and will both own a small book of business and lead a team of up to 4 people, who are aligned to Indeed’s Public Sector accounts, and are tasked with supporting these companies to make their next great hires through Indeed. By creating innovative data analytics and narratives, they will help the Sales & CS team identify opportunities to sell, upsell, cross sell and winbacks through data-driven analysis and make recommendations to ultimately help the team hit their revenue goals. Indeed seeks a self-motivated mentor skilled in business development, people management, critical thinking, problem-solving, and execution for this role.gement, critical thinking, problem-solving capabilities and the drive and energy to execute rapidly.

**Responsibilities**

* Drive the CSI team to deliver data-driven insights for sales, cross-selling, upselling, and win-back strategies across all spending and non spending accounts.
* Communicates ground-level insights to senior leaders, providing strategic input. Aligns with and informs senior leadership to ensure informed findings. Present actionable recommendations to CSIX Leadership, Sales leadership and/or clients
* Drive collaborative development of Public Sector Go-to-Market strategies across teams. Optimize sales alignment with clear purpose and vision. Manage diverse client portfolio for maximum coverage and ROI using customized analytics and technology for scale
* Coach team on account planning, execution, problem-solving, and data analysis to maximize revenue potential. Test new targeting strategies or optimize existing ones across a large book of business for better segmentation.
* Partner with various internal teams to develop scalable tools integrating Indeed's data-backed capabilities for customers.
* Act as Public Sector SME, overseeing projects, deadlines, stakeholder relations, and promptly delivering ad-hoc requests with expertise and efficiency. Key emphasis on sophisticated output that is easy to digest
* Encourage teamwork, foster agility, and strive for excellence. Welcome feedback, take ownership, and nurture relationships across Indeed and with clients.

**Skills/Competencies**

* Bachelor's with 7+ years of experience delivering quantitative analysis and data-led narratives to clients in fields like technology, media, consulting, sales, marketing. Experience with data modeling, statistical and ROI assessment
* Engaging storyteller adept at influencing internal teams and external clients through compelling written and verbal presentations. Ability to vary levels of granularity based on audience.
* Proficient in problem-solving, parsing large datasets, translating data into actionable insights, with a focus on maximizing return on investment.
* Proactive in identifying opportunities, working cross functionally, leading your team to own business partnerships to collaborate towards scalable solutions.
* Technical skills (SQL, Python, Tableau or similar) for data extraction, interpretation, and visualization
* Self directed with the ability to thrive in an unstructured environment and comfortable with ambiguity. Willing to travel (10-25% of the time as needed)

**Salary Range Transparency**

NYC Metro Area 122,000 - 180,000 USD per year

Austin, TX- 110,000- 153,000 USD per year

US Remote- 110,000-153,000 USD per year

**Salary Range Disclaimer**

The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position in the given work location. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range(s) listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), a Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.

**Benefits - Health, Work/Life Harmony, & Wellbeing**

We care about what you care about. We have a multitude of benefits to support Indeedians, as well as their pets, kids, and partners including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance. Indeedians are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan, as well as an equity-based incentive program. Indeedians will also receive open paid time off, 12 paid holidays a year and up to 26 weeks of paid parental leave. For more information, select your country and learn more about our employee benefits, program, & perks at https://benefits.indeed.jobs!

**Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement**

Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Accommodations at 1-855-567-7767, or by email at accommodations@indeed.com. If you are requesting accommodation for an interview, please reach out at least one week in advance of your interview.  
**Fair Chance Hiring**  
We value diverse experiences, including those who have had prior contact with the criminal legal system. We are committed to providing individuals with criminal records, including formerly incarcerated individuals, a fair chance at employment.

**Indeed’s Employee Recruiting Privacy Policy**

Like other employers Indeed uses our own technologies to help us find and attract top talent from around the world. In addition to our site’s user and privacy policy found at https://www.indeed.com/legal, we also want to make you aware of our recruitment specific privacy policy found at https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobs.
