title: Sr. Analyst, Operational Excellence, Strategy & Insights
description:
It is an exciting time to be part of the PatientPoint team! As the clear leader in the point-of-care industry, we offer an ideal, people-focused place to **innovate**, positively **impact** patient education and doctor-patient connections, and **be** **inspired** to build a great career.  

  

**Location:** Cincinnati, OH  

  

**Hybrid Schedule:** 3 days in office / 2 days at home weekly  

  

**Job Summary**  

We are seeking a Senior Analyst within our Strategy & Insights team. As Sr. Analyst, you will act as support to a Customer Strategy Lead, supporting them as they act as a customer's key point of contact within the team. You will play a key role in managing the timing and execution of third-party market research projects and evaluating customer ad performance.  

  

In addition, you are comfortable translating results provided by a third-party vendor into concise PowerPoint slides. Attention to detail and the ability to investigate data discrepancies are important to the role. Leveraging your strong relationship building and analytical abilities, you will collaborate within the team to optimize the analysis process and help pinpoint areas of improvement and efficiency.  

  

This role reports into an Operational Excellence Lead and collaborates with fellow analysts on the team. Preference will be given to candidates with previous experience in market research to evaluate ad performance or working within a digital healthcare marketing/media company using data to gauge marketing program performance.  

  

**What You'll Do**  

* Functional Area Management: This position is directly responsible for the planning, execution, and delivery of program performance results to internal teams. This includes metrics like brand lift and ROI.
* Familiarity with statistics: While direct calculation and use of statistical methods and advanced analytics techniques is not required, the ability to interpret them to identify concerns around statistical significance, patterns, trends, and correlations is key.
* Collaborate with internal teams (Decision Science, Operations, Sales, Strategy Leads): Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand brand needs and be able to investigate varying inputs into performance and contract details.
* Present findings internally: Communicate complex analytical findings in a clear and concise manner to internal teams, establishing trust and confidence in yourself and the team.

  

**What We Need**  

* Communication skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey complex analytical concepts and details to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Experience in creating compelling data visualizations is a plus.
* Collaboration and teamwork: Proven ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment, including a Sales team.
* Problem-solving orientation: Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically, identify patterns, and propose innovative solutions.
* Attention to detail: Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality, accurate, and reliable analytical work products.
* Continuous learning mindset: Eagerness to stay updated on the latest advancements in analytics, data science, and pharmaceutical industry trends through self-learning and participating in relevant training programs.
* Critical thinking: Experience thinking through the best approach to solving issues at hand.

  

**Desired Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's degree in a related field is required. Proven experience (5-7 years) in a similar role, preferably in a role allowing ownership of research projects and calendars.
* Analytical skills: Strong analytical mindset with strong working knowledge of statistical analysis.
* Proficient in using Excel, PowerPoint, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

  

**What You'll Need to Succeed**  

* Self-motivation, strong ambition, and interest in directly impacting business results.
* Resourcefulness, multi-tasking skills and creative problem-solving skills.
* Resiliency and ability to overcome challenges, sound business judgment.
* Passion for relationship building and building trusted partnerships.
  

  

  

**What We Offer** We know you bring your whole self to work every day. That is why we are committed to providing modernized benefits and cultural perks to our teammates. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive and affordable benefits, flex time off to rest and charge, where applicable, a hybrid work model, mental & emotional wellness resources and coaching, 401K and more.
  

  

**About PatientPoint** PatientPoint ® is a leading digital health company that connects patients, healthcare providers and life sciences companies with the right information in the moments care decisions are made. Our solutions are proven to influence patient behavior and improve health outcomes, driving value for all stakeholders. Across the nation's largest network of connected digital devices in 35,000 physician offices, PatientPoint solutions empower better health for more than 750 million patient visits each year. Learn more at patientpoint.com.  

  

PatientPoint recognizes that privacy is important to you. Please read the PatientPoint privacy policy, we want you to be familiar with how we may collect, use, and disclose your information. Employer is EOE/M/F/D/V

title: Senior Director Analyst, Advanced Manufacturing, PLM (US Remote - Eastern/Central Time Zones)
description:
**Description**
---------------


**About the role:**

Have you seen the future? Do you look around and see what is happening and have a pretty good idea about how all these tendrils will come together, leading to a different outcome in the manufacturing sector than perhaps the general wisdom?


We are looking for a candidate who understands the history and future of manufacturing, particularly how technology and business collide. A strong knowledge of the major technology trends and how they are being implemented is important. Must have product development experience using PLM in a process industry (preferred), or in adjacent industry segment as consumer goods and discrete manufacturing. We need someone who feels comfortable talking to manufacturing C-suite executives and advising technology companies on how to approach the market. Knowledge of the broader process industry landscape, including how technology, regulation and society are changing and affecting chemicals, metals, paper and pulp and F&B are bonuses as well. People who are creative and curious and have a desire to learn how things work are more interesting for this role than people who are content to rest on a mountain of knowledge. People who have pulled together and published reports, white papers and articles or have presented on stage are desirable.


Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner’s Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels. Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.


**What you will do:**

* Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged content.
* Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act.
* Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client’s barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward.
* Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts.
* Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda.
* Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights.
* Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions.
* Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings.
* Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business.
* Provide high quality and timely research content peer review.
* Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy.
* Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community.
* Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery.
* Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members.
* Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions.

**What you will need:**

* Bachelor's degree and 12+ years of experience in a related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Prior experience working with PLM and PLM adjacent topics like design and engineering, simulation, integration experience with ERP/MES in the manufacturing industry, with a focus on process industry, directly for manufacturers or via consulting/system integrators.
* Subject matter expertise in PLM-related topics, such as specifications management, recipe and formula management, labelling and artwork, product portfolio management, packaging and regulatory compliance standards and/or product circularity.
* Process and functional experience across the product development and manufacturing value chain
* System deployment experience in PLM/ERP/MES
* Additional bonuses: IT/OT Integration, Industrial IoT, Smart Manufacturing
* Strong organizational skills: ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables.
* Demonstrated research and writing ability.
* Strong written, verbal, analytical and presentation skills, able to communicate complex concepts concisely to clients and internal and external stakeholders.
* Ability to analyze and synthesize data.
* Ability to work independently as well as a collaborative member of the team supporting the workflow of others, in a global team environment.
* Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels.
* 5-10% willingness and ability to travel to team/client events

#LI-ML3


**Who are we?**

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT), we deliver actionable, objective insight that drives smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s mission-critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.


**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**

Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner


**What we offer:**

Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.


Gartner believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is 150,000 USD - 190,000 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. Our talent acquisition team will provide the specific opportunity on our bonus or incentive programs to eligible candidates. We also offer market leading benefit programs including generous PTO, a 401k match up to $7,200 per year, the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount, and more.  

  

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.


Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com .


Job Requisition ID:85886
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.


Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

title: Strategic Ops Analyst
description:
**ABOUT PLACER.AI****:**



Placer.ai is a fast-growing big data startup led by seasoned executives and repeat entrepreneurs who are building the world's first "Google Analytics for the physical world." Placer.ai’s platform provides instant visibility into any property in the U.S., presenting accurate details about visitation patterns and demographic breakdowns of visitors. Placer.ai’s customers can see where visitors have been before, where they go afterwards, where they typically go for sports, entertainment, groceries, etc., and what their interests are. Placer.ai's A.I.-based SaaS platform replaces archaic solutions such as manual surveys, installed cameras and other people-counting systems, creating a blue ocean market of more than $100B.



Placer.ai has grown 2-3x year-over-year for the past 3 years, counting more than 3,500 paying customers across a range of industries, including many of the world’s top companies in retail, CPG, hospitality, commercial real estate, asset management and private equity. The company has raised over $180m from investors, most recently as a “unicorn” ($1b+ valuation).


**SUMMARY:**



The Strategic Ops Analyst will be the first hire in a new team reporting to the company’s Special Ops Director (who reports directly to the CEO and is responsible for the CEO’s Office and go-to-market planning and execution). The Strategic Ops Analyst will support the Special Ops Director in a range of operational and strategic processes and projects, including: supporting the CEO and other executive business needs; pursuing executive-led revenue and business development opportunities; research, tracking and reporting projects; tracking KPIs across the organization; operational coordination of strategy and go-to-market plans; identifying barriers to success and opportunities for improvement - and helping executing on them.



The role is a unique opportunity for professional growth and learning through exposure to the operations and strategy of a hyper-scaling startup.



The Strategic Ops Analyst will be operationally-minded with excellent project management and communication skills; strong technical skills; motivated to learn and improve; have high attention to detail; and a clear bias for action and results.


**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**


* **CEO & Executive support**: Support the Special Ops Director in driving the CEO’s and company’s ongoing business needs (research, operational assignments, thought leadership initiatives).
* **Stakeholder-led business development:** researching, tracking andsupporting the driving of both revenue and non-revenue business leads via Placer extensive stakeholder network (investors, partners, strategic customers, executive team members).
* **Research & Reporting including: weekly reporting of business updates; reporting/tracking of key business processes, KPIs, and identifying areas for improvement.**
* **Organizational projects:** working on key CEO and company projects (e.g. go-to-market offsites, customer advisory boards)
* **Support other special initiatives and projects** as they arise.


**REQUIREMENTS:**


* **Bachelor’s degree** (any field) or **equivalent work experience**
* **2 years min. experience** preferred in a business/operational function
* **English** at mother tongue level
* **Self-starter** and **high degree of motivation** to go above and beyond the task at hand, as well as learn and grow with the company.
* **Strong analytical skills**: you have a data-driven mentality and high attention to detail; you are proficient with spreadsheets and excited to dig through data to get actionable insights
* **Outstanding written English communication skills:** adept at report-writing and drafting internal communications and PR content.
* **Project management & getting things done:** you have a track record of managing projects, leading them to completion, and following up to ensure success
* **Flexibility**: you are comfortable working in a fast-paced remote startup environment that will require you to manage competing priorities, pivot quickly and often, and communicate often on progress to your team members. You’re excited to take on big ambiguous problems that haven’t been tackled before.


**BONUS POINTS:**


* MBA or other Master’s degree
* Experience that demonstrates ability to climb a steep learning curve
* Experience in a high-growth SaaS company and/or Operations/GTM functions
* Knowledge of Salesforce, Monday.com and other CRM or project management platforms


**WHY JOIN PLACER.AI?**


* Join a rocketship! We are pioneers of a new market that we are creating.
* Take a central and critical role at Placer.ai.
* Work with, and learn from, top-notch talent.
* Competitive salary.
* Excellent benefits.
* Fully remote.


**NOTEWORTHY LINKS TO LEARN MORE ABOUT PLACER**


* Placer.ai in a nutshell
* Placer.ai's recent $100M round C funding (unicorn valuation!)
* Placer.ai's data
* Placer.ai in the news
* COVID-19 Economic Recovery Dashboard


*Placer.ai is an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.*


*Placer.ai’s applicants are considered solely based on their qualifications, without regard to an applicant’s disability or need for accommodation. Any Placer.ai applicant who requires reasonable accommodations during the application process should contact Placer.ai’s Human Resources Department to make the need for an accommodation known..*

title: Director, Market Research - Biotech (Remote)
description:
Myriad Genetics discovers, develops, and commercializes molecular genetic tests that determine the risk developing disease, assess disease progression, and guide treatment decisions in Oncology, Women’s Health, and Mental Health. We are a pioneer and leader in genomic research, and we are committed to advancing the science of personalized medicine as we refine and develop more products to address unmet medical needs.


We are seeking a Director of Market Research to develop and execute the enterprise’s market and voice of customer research program. This Market Research Director will build a best-in-class market research program including but not limited to driving client/customer and competitor insights that influence product and experience design; delivering on clear, executable insights for executive leadership by mining quantitative and qualitative data; building, improving, and managing enterprise-wide responsibility of Myriad’s Customer Experience (NPS) program; and embedding timely, accurate and relevant insights into Myriad’s market positioning across all business units. This Market Research Director will report to the VP of Commercial Strategy and Planning.


Our ideal candidate brings passion for the pillars of our culture: collaboration, innovation, inclusion, caring, and commitment. This Director, Market Research will be curious, pro-active, able to work across organizations, and driven to help shape the future of this company. At Myriad Genetics, our future is yours to create.


**What you will do:**

* Own annual cross-portfolio ATU study that informs all product level assessment for the year.
* Own annual Brand Equity research and socialization of results among BUs, Enterprise and Executive leadership.
* Advance the Myriad Genetics Customer Experience (VoC/NPS) program across the enterprise, while fully owning the Loyalty survey component for the company.
* Accountable for implementing the NPS program feedback loop and creating a system of accountability across the enterprise.
* Align with key business, market and product teams to support research inputs that inform product designs and market launches, with full ownership and responsibility of the primary research conducted to inform business cases.
* Ownership of key vendor relationships, like Medallia and responsibility to program manage effective implementation of the tech stack (i.e., integration with Salesforce) in support of key business needs across the enterprise.
* Support the commercial strategy team (Sr. Director and Director of Market Intelligence) with needs arising from ad hoc projects requested by leadership.

**Qualifications:**

* 10+ years of experience in market research and 6+ years in healthcare (preferably biotech, medical device, or pharmaceutical industries)
* Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s Degree or certificates in market research preferred
* Education or experience in business, marketing, market research, life science (i.e. biology), entrepreneurial studies, social science, or related field
* Adept at market research design, execution, and insight synthesis
* Able to triage complex business objectives into discrete questions that can be informed with primary and secondary market inputs.
* Experience with the following:
	+ self-serve Market Research tools or platforms
	+ ownership of market research vendor relationships
	+ CX program platforms, preferably with Certification in Medallia
	+ enterprise level experience or cross-matrixed organizational experience
* Strong organizational skills and leadership orientation
* Business acumen: critical thinking, analysis, problem solving skills and driving to insights
* Leadership: Demonstrated ability to establish and lead programs / teams
* Influence: proven ability to work with/influence across all levels and functions within the organization to achieve actionable results through others
* Agility: high degree of flexibility and the ability to work within a fluid, constantly changing environment.
* Proactive: thinks ahead with a focus on closely managing stakeholders to limit the element of surprise and unnecessary churn.
* Self-starter: able to work as an independent contributor while networking across the organization.

#LI-JB2


  
Myriad Genetics Inc., is a leading personalized medicine company dedicated to being a trusted advisor transforming patient lives worldwide with pioneering molecular diagnostics. Myriad discovers and commercializes molecular diagnostic tests that: determine the risk of developing disease, accurately diagnose disease, assess the risk of disease progression, and guide treatment decisions across six major medical specialties where molecular diagnostics can significantly improve patient care and lower healthcare costs. Myriad is focused on three strategic imperatives: maintaining leadership in an expanding hereditary cancer market, diversifying its product portfolio through the introduction of new products and increasing the revenue contribution from international markets. For more information on how Myriad is making a difference, please visit the Company's website: www.myriad.com .  

  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. In hiring and all other employment decisions, we prohibit discrimination and harassment on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Tail Spend Analyst, Indirect Sourcing & Procurement
description:
Overview:
**LogicSource Overview**  

LogicSource is an innovative and leading indirect sourcing and procurement professional services firm. We partner with consumer facing companies identifying value through improved indirect spend management, allowing our clients to save money, boost EBITDA and generate much-needed cash to finance growth opportunities. LogicSource is owned and operated by an experienced group of global business veterans who came together under a common goal to radically change the way indirect sourcing and procurement works. We’ve reinvented sourcing and procurement with an execution-based, fully transparent business model that ensures our clients benefit from our spend leverage, market intelligence, subject matter expertise and supplier ecosystem.


Our people gain exposure to a diversity of projects and clients spanning a broad set of categories across multiple industries. We offer significant opportunities to grow and learn working with domain experts across a variety of business functions.


Our business model reflects our culture – radically different and filled with opportunity to make a difference. Our professionals enjoy the intellectual stimulation, challenge and satisfaction in a marketplace that is dynamically changing with exciting growth in the near future.

 **Position Summary**  

We have an immediate opening for a full-time Tail Spend Analyst, Indirect Sourcing & Procurement at our omni-channel retail client based in Nashville, TN. This position will play a critical role for LogicSource providing an analytical & reporting function to support tactical sourcing operations and the onsite team. The scope for this role will be focused on our Client’s large tail of Indirect vendors with annual spend below $50,000 per year, across several major indirect categories including IT, Corporate Services, Marketing Print, Marketing Services, Distribution & Logistics, Tail Spend and Facilities. The role will report to the Account Lead.
Responsibilities:
**Responsibilities**  

* Analyze and produce meaningful interpretations and actionable results from spend tools (OneMarket Insights) and other client data
* Identify opportunities within Tail Spend to eliminate and block rogue vendors, supplier consolidation opportunities, and routing small-spend suppliers into tactical and strategic sourcing projects
* Provide procurement and analytical support to Indirect Procurement team
* Collaborate with the Client’s internal stakeholders to identify and secure relevant data for analysis
* Deliver on-going analytical support to Sourcing Managers and the Center of Excellence (COE)
* Support activities throughout procurement and sourcing team to monitor spend under management and spend under contract
* Read and extract inconsistencies within contracts and add value by outlining required SLAs
* Engage analytical resources at LogicSource’s COE to ensure timely delivery of pertinent financial information
* Deliver accurate and timely information to finance for issuance of invoices to the client
* Monitor and report on key performance initiatives (KPIs) such as savings vs. baseline, purchase compliance to contract rates and usage versus demand management forecasts
* Ensure procurement activities comply with all client policies and procedures including legal and regulatory
* Maintain efficient and courteous relationship with client, vendors, and internal client contractors


Qualifications:
**Required Education and Experience**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain, finance, economics or accounting
* 3+ years of experience in analysis, financial and/or operational reporting roles
* Fluent with reporting systems, internet research, and general forms of technical infrastructure
* Proficient at Excel/financial analysis and planning
* Ability to turn complex data into meaningful reports
* Strong organizational and communication skills
* Exposure to strategic & tactical sourcing, procurement, contract administration, and/or project management processes
* Strong attention to detail
* Self-starter with ability to multi-task, make sound business decisions, and find hidden opportunities

 **Travel**  

This position requires very limited to no travel. **Other Duties**  

This position description is not an exhaustive list of the duties and responsibilities, and the employee is expected to perform other duties as necessary and assigned. The duties and responsibilities of this position may be modified at any time to meet changing business needs.

title: Sr. Manager of Revenue Analytics and Insights
description:
**Company Overview**
--------------------



ID.me is a high-growth enterprise software company that simplifies how people prove and share their identity online. The company empowers people to control their data through a portable and trusted login, which means they don't need to create a new password when visiting sites that have the ID.me button. ID.me's digital identity network has over 117 million registered members, and is used by fourteen federal agencies, agencies in 30 states and over 600 corporations for secure identity proofing and verification.



ID.me's technology meets the federal standards for consumer authentication set by the Commerce Department and is approved as a NIST 800-63-3 IAL2 / AAL2 credential service provider by the Kantara Initiative. In addition to helping people control their credentials and data, the company's "No Identity Left Behind" initiative strives to expand digital access and inclusion for all people. The company offers multiple pathways to identity verification – online self-serve, live video chat agents, and in person. ID.me is passionate about building a robust identity network that does not compromise access for traditionally underserved groups.



ID.me has received numerous awards including Deloitte's 2023 Technology Fast 500, Washington Business Journal's Fastest Growing Companies, Entrepreneur Magazine's 100 Brilliant Companies and Wall Street Journal's Startup of the Year finalist. In recent quarters, ID.me announced it raised $132 million in Series D funding, led by Viking Global Investors with participation from CapitalG, Morgan Stanley Counterpoint, FTV Capital, PSP Growth, Auctus Investment Group, Moonshots Capital, and Scout Ventures. ID.me's most recent round brings the total investment in ID.me to over $275 million since its founding in 2010.


We are seeking a senior-level analytics leader to join our Revenue Operations Analytics team to drive data-informed strategies for our Go-to-Market organization. This person will lead the development of analytics platforms, data models, and advanced analyses to optimize sales, marketing, and customer success functions.

  



Responsibilities:


* Drive data strategy and governance by designing, implementing and optimizing data pipelines and infrastructure leveraging tools like Snowflake, Databricks, DBT, etc.
* Develop custom data models, dashboards, analyses and machine learning models to derive insights from company data sources across sales, marketing, customer success, product and more.
* Create compelling data visualizations, reports and presentations to provide business insights into growth opportunities, marketing effectiveness, sales pipeline, forecasting and more.
* Clearly communicate analytic findings and recommendations to the executive and GTM leadership team, as well technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization.
* Develop and track metrics tied to revenue team goals and corporate KPIS related to sales, customer acquisition/retention, and marketing ROI.
* Lead data-oriented analytics projects and initiatives designed to significantly improve conversion rates, grow revenue, reduce customer churn and strengthen financial outlook.
* Coach and mentor more junior analysts on the team.


Requirements:


* 7+ years experience in data analytics, preferably supporting high-growth revenue organizations.
* Strong data acumen with expertise in SQL, advanced statistical modeling and tools like Python or R
* Expert knowledge of data platforms like Snowflake, Databricks, BigQuery as well as ETL/data workflow tools like DBT.
* Experience with business intelligence and visualization tools like Tableau and ThoughtSpot.
* Strong record of delivering impactful data products and analytics to drive business decisions.
* Outstanding communication and storytelling abilities to relay complex data insights to a variety of business stakeholders
* Entrepreneurial self-starter comfortable dealing with ambiguity and driving measurable outcomes
* Experience building, developing and retaining strong teams of analysts/scientists preferred
* Passion for using cutting-edge analytics to solve challenging business problems


The annual base salary listed below for this role is based on experience, skills, education, relevant training and geographic location. Company bonus, incentive for sales roles, equity, and benefits are available depending on the role.



ID.me offers comprehensive medical, dental, vision, health savings account, flexible spending accounts (medical, limited purpose, dependent care, commuter benefit accounts), basic and voluntary life and AD&D insurance, 401(k) with company match, parental leave, ability to participate in unlimited paid time off subject to the terms and conditions of the PTO policy, including 8 company wide holidays, short and long-term disability insurance, accident and critical illness insurance, referral bonus policy, employee assistance program, pet insurance, travel assistant program, wellbeing and childcare discounts, benefit advocates, and a learning and development benefit.



The above represents the anticipated total rewards package for this job requisition. Final offers may vary from the amount listed based on qualifications, professional experiences, skills, education, relevant training, geographic location, and other job related factors.

title: Analyst - Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
description:
McGaw.io, a Marketing Technology & Marketing Analytics consultancy, is searching for a CRO Analyst to join our team and work directly with our account leads and clients to drive positive business results and build strong relationships.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Our mission at McGaw.io is to help companies of all sizes realize their customer data is their most valuable business asset. We help them realize this through customer data infrastructure, high-power analytics, marketing automation, personalization and funnel optimization.
McGaw.io supports businesses with analytics, marketing automation, customer data platforms, data piping, websites, AB testing, and marketing operations. As we derive insights from these technical efforts, we also inform & execute growth strategies that routinely move the needle for our clients.


Our track record is impeccable, and our leadership has supported some of the fastest-growing companies in the world. McGaw.io’s core client base sells online and has complex data and marketing practices that drive our team to dig deeper every day.

**Position's Mission:**


The Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Analyst's mission is to conduct research that leads clients to a significant, market-leading advantage. Hyperfocused on using quantitative and qualitative user behavior data sources, you will define the question to answer, collect, clean, analyze, and share your findings, which will play a key role in defining our game-changing client strategies.

**Responsible for**

* Analyze website traffic, user behavior, and revenue data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
* Gather and interpret data using tools such as Google Analytics, Amplitude, Mixpanel, MS Clarity, Hotjar, Sheets, Looker Studio, and other relevant platforms.
* Develop hypotheses based on data analysis and collaborate with the design and development teams for implementation.
* Conduct user research to understand the needs, preferences, and pain points of target audiences.
* Work closely with the design and development team to implement A/B tests.
* Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.
* Create and maintain regular reports on key performance indicators.
* Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
* Propose and implement new processes to improve the CRO data reporting process.

 **Skills, talents, and experiences needed to create superior results.**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field
* 4+ years of proven experience in a similar role focusing on CRO and data analysis, working across multiple projects, workstreams, and clients
* 4+ years of analytical proficiency with Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Google Sheets to an advanced level. Current certification for one or more of these tools would be seen as a big advantage
* 4+ years of experience carrying out CRO and A/B work in a fast-paced agency
* Ability to answer specific questions accurately and quickly through quantitative or qualitative data analysis
* A clear understanding of highly converting copywriting and UX/UI principles
* Excellent communication skills and ability to present findings to non-technical stakeholders
* Detail-oriented with a passion for continuous improvement
* Data-driven mindset with proven experience utilizing metrics & insights as tools for informed decision-making
* Proactive in delivery and able to plan for short and long-term priorities.
* An extreme eye for detail and accurate work

 **Observable indicators to let you know you are performing well in this role.**

* Project Performance: Maintain an average LER of 3.0 across all projects (total project revenue / total billable hours cost) by your 90th day
* Project Management: Estimated timing and dependencies mapped out in Trello for the next two months for 75% of projects by your 90th day
* CRO Research: You will own the CRO research process of gathering data from various sources. You must complete your first research and discovery report by your 90th day.
* Test Reporting: You will own test reporting from A/B tests. This requires you to produce meaningful and usable AB test reports at the end of each test by your 60th day.
* Test Roadmaps: You will own the test road mapping of projects and have produced your first 6-month roadmap by your 90th day.

 **Job Description:**


As the CRO Analyst, you will work on the client services team. Your primary focus will be discovering insights, planning, and reporting on tests, enabling our clients to grow quickly. That will happen by supporting the account lead strategy in delivering and accurately estimating scheduled projects and tasks. As a supporting team member to account leads, you will be involved with surfacing insights from various data sources, writing test hypotheses, analyzing their possible outcomes, validating tests, and reporting on test outcomes. Then, work with the account lead to deliver tests and reports that move the needle for our clients.


You’ll also be in charge of prioritizing tests for delivery using our VICE Sheet. That includes accurately updating the VICE Sheet with test results and building our client knowledge base.


This is a data-heavy role. On the client services team, you will embody one of our company values: creating transparency through data.


In your first three months, you will learn our project management process and take over CRO Analyst responsibilities for all active projects.


This work will feed into working with account leads to adjust 6-month roadmaps for all clients and help us develop more rigorous data analysis, processes, and procedures.


In the next three months, you will continue to learn the funnel optimization research process and report on all clients' projects while holding yourself accountable to the observable indicators listed in the bullets above.


In the following three months, we expect you to be delivering client work effectively and efficiently and will start to guide how we can improve our data analysis process.


In the final three months of your first year, we expect you to have mastered the project management process, completed your growth plan, be able to accurately estimate and deliver client work, and regularly provide test reports that instruct our future funnel optimization strategy.

**Benefits:**

* Unlimited PTO
* Flexible hours
* Work remotely
* Premium Health, Dental, and Visions Insurance (dependent coverage offered)
* Maternity/Paternity Leave
* Competitive salary with opportunities for bonuses
* Company Laptop, Monitor, and other equipment needed for remote setup
* Federal holidays off for US Citizens and national holidays off for international employees
* Radically transparent workplace
* Ample opportunity to implement your ideas and suggestions
* Become a thought leader in the marketing technology community
* Continued education and training that exceeds what you have ever seen before
* $25 monthly Starbucks allowance
* $50 Uber Eats allowance




6plt105KwP

title: Go-to-Market Strategy Expert for Data & Analytics Providers, Sr. Director Analyst, Remote US
description:
**Description**
---------------


**About the role:**

The Go-to-Market Expert is a Gartner Analyst who serves as a trusted advisor to CEOs of technology vendor organizations, providing insights and recommendations on optimal approaches for market positioning, product strategy, pricing, partnerships, and other go-to-market priorities. Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, including market predictions and best practices. A Senior Director serves as a leader within the practice and must be a highly credible voice within their designated areas of coverage.


Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director produces pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.


**What you will do:**

* Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged “must-have research” content that advises Tech CEOs and senior executives how to improve their go-to-market results.
* Advise Tech CEOs and senior executives on strategic decisions to help them establish and scale their organizations.
* Develop new research and ideas that offers compelling, actionable approaches and accelerates the client’s ability to act.
* Develop in-depth analyses to identify the root causes of a client’s challenges or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive the client’s strategy forward.
* Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a global team of analysts.
* Bring forward provocative, independent insights that can evolve the course of Gartner’s research agenda.
* Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients with actionable insights.
* Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice via virtual or face-to-face interactions.
* Create and deliver high value presentation materials for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings.
* Provide sales support to help drive engagement with prospects and clients.
* Provide high quality and timely peer review of colleagues’ research content.
* Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy.
* Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers within the Gartner research community
* Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the Gartner team provide excellent service delivery
* Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
* Maintain a client-centric focus and actively seek to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions

**What you will need** :


* Bachelor’s degree and 12 years of experience in a related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience
* Data and analytics market segments experience, including an understanding of buyer priorities and competitive dynamics.
* Deep intellectual curiosity about the best approaches for success for a startup or early-stage tech company
* Demonstrable executive presence; can immediately establish credibility with executives and other stakeholders.
* Strong organizational skills: ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables.
* Ability to conduct independent research.
* Ability to document ideas in writing, and to communicate logical arguments clearly and effectively in written form.
* Ability to engage clients and respond effectively to spontaneous questions.
* Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; effectively applying patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.
* Strong communicator; able to explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
* Comfortable presenting in-person or via webinar to audiences of 100 or more
* Deep knowledge of the global technology industry and vendor landscape
* Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team.
* Adept at learning new concepts and agile in navigating highly matrixed environments.
* Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels.
* Willingness and ability to travel up to 15%

**Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience in early-stage technology companies (organizations with less than $100M in annual revenue)
* Direct experience in the role of CEO, founder, CMO/VP of Marketing or CPO/VP of Product
* Consulting experience
* MBA

#LI-Remote #LI-LT1


**Who are we?**

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT), we deliver actionable, objective insight that drives smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s mission-critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.


**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**

Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner


**What we offer:**

Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.


Gartner believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is 150,000 USD - 190,000 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. Our talent acquisition team will provide the specific opportunity on our bonus or incentive programs to eligible candidates. We also offer market leading benefit programs including generous PTO, a 401k match up to $7,200 per year, the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount, and more.  

  

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.


Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com .
